availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jacob Stokeley (Scott County, Kentucky, farm laborer.)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farm laborer and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah F. Peacher Stokeley in Scott County, Kentucky, on January 18, 1855. Father of Mary E. Stokeley, John Stokeley, and Robert Stokeley. Farmer in Bourbon County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eighteen enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1850. Resident of Scott County, Kentucky, in 1855. Farm laborer in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1860. Farmer in Scott County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, pp. 282A-B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 1, p. 931.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Ruddles Mills Precinct, p. 168A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Scott County, KY, July 1863, p. 17.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994054, Scott County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Scott County Marriages, Film 000183225.
KYR-0001-020-0462.
